imageAlt: Various devices from phones to laptops showing the DTI website
name: IDOL
description: IDOL – Internal DTI Organization Logic – is our very own internal tools subteam. Responsible for developing and maintaining this website, recruitment tools, internal coffee chat tracking, and other administrative systems.

imageAlt: 3 phones side by side, displaying the login, map, and profile screens of the CornellGO Application
name: CornellGO
description: Navigating Campus for the first time is confusing. CornellGO is a scavenger hunt app that makes discovering campus easy and fun through interactive, location-based challenges. Launching this semester.

imageAlt: A laptop next to a phone, displaying the search page and the search results page of the CU Reviews website
name: CU Reviews
description: CU Reviews is a course review website. You can browse classes and view their metrics, read about other students' experiences, and submit your own course reviews for others.

imageAlt: A desktop computer next to a laptop, displaying the planning page and the profile page of the Course Plan website
name: CoursePlan
description: Start your college career here with us. CoursePlan has everything you need to fulfill your requirements, all in one place. You can design your 4-year plan by simply dragging them into your schedule.

imageAlt: A display showing a dashbord of the Queue Me In application with a lists of students waiting in line for office hours
name: Queue Me In
description: Office hours are too crowded and unorganized. Queue Me In removes the frustration from office hours by helping students get support and professors better understand their classes.

imageAlt: A laptop next to a phone, displaying home page and an address page of the CU Apts website
name: CU Apts
description: The search for off-campus housing in Ithaca is insane. CU Apts helps you search for off-campus housing, share apartment reviews, and explore your best options.

imageAlt: 2 tablets showing the homepage and articles page of the Design @ Cornell website
name: Design @ Cornell
description: Design @ Cornell is a centralized repository that contains all the resources and information needed for faculty, staff, current and future students interested in design at Cornell.

imageAlt: A desktop computer next to a tablet, displaying the landing page and questionnaire page of the Zing website
name: Zing
description: Collaborating with The Learning Strategies Center (LSC) at Cornell, Zing is an all-in-one web interface to create optimal groups for class projects based on students' study preferences.

imageAlt: 2 laptops showing the map and scheduled rides page of the Carriage application
name: Carriage
description: Carriage is dedicated to making Cornell accessible for all students and work directly with CULift, Cornell's paratransit service for students with disabilities. Launching next semester.
